name: rustypaste
readme_summary: Rustypaste is a minimal, self-hostable file upload and pastebin service written in Rust. It supports features like file uploading, URL shortening, setting expiration times for files, one-shot links, MIME type guessing, and optional authentication. It can be deployed via Docker or built from source.
primary_use_case: Sharing files and text snippets quickly and easily via a web service.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a friendly postman delivering packages to floating islands in the sky, each island representing a user. The postman carries a satchel overflowing with letters and parcels (files and URLs), some glowing with timers indicating expiration. One island has a 'one-time view' sign. A subtle UI overlay shows a simplified upload form and a shortened URL. The scene is set in a bright, cheerful sky with fluffy clouds. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and clean, clear details, subtly incorporating the 'rustypaste' logo on the postman's bag.

name: PSCompletions
description: A completion manager for a better and simpler tab-completion experience in PowerShell.
readme_summary: PSCompletions is a PowerShell module designed to enhance the tab-completion experience. It provides a more powerful completion menu, allows for managing completions, dynamically sorts completion items based on usage frequency, and supports multiple languages. It aims to simplify and improve the user's interaction with PowerShell by offering intelligent and customizable tab completion.
key_features: Sort completion items dynamically by frequency of use
primary_use_case: Improving and simplifying tab-completion in PowerShell.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a skilled librarian organizing a vast collection of books (PowerShell commands) with magical speed and precision. The librarian uses a special lens that highlights the most frequently accessed books, placing them within easy reach. A subtle UI overlay shows a completion menu dynamically updating as the librarian works. Digital particles representing code snippets float around the scene. The repository name, 'PSCompletions,' is subtly etched on the librarian's desk. The scene is brightly lit and set in a modern, minimalist library. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with clean lines and vibrant colors.

name: Mantella
description: Mantella is a Skyrim and Fallout 4 mod which allows you to naturally speak to NPCs using Whisper (speech-to-text), LLMs (text generation), and Piper / xVASynth / XTTS (text-to-speech).
readme_summary: Mantella is a Python-based mod for Skyrim and Fallout 4 that enables natural language interaction with NPCs. It leverages speech-to-text (Whisper), Large Language Models (LLMs) for response generation, and text-to-speech (Piper, xVASynth, XTTS) for vocalization, creating a more immersive and dynamic gameplay experience.
key_features: Text-to-speech using Piper, xVASynth, and XTTS
Mod support for Skyrim and Fallout 4
primary_use_case: Enabling natural language conversations with NPCs in Skyrim and Fallout 4, enhancing immersion and gameplay.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a medieval scribe in Skyrim, quill in hand, listening intently to a glowing orb representing a player's spoken words. The scribe then consults a magical tome (an LLM) that illuminates with possible responses, which he then speaks aloud, his voice echoing with the synthesized tones of an NPC. UI elements float subtly nearby, showing speech bubbles and code snippets. The scene is set in a cozy, firelit study within a wizard's tower. Digital particles swirl around the orb and the tome, connecting the ancient setting to modern technology. The composition is focused and warm, with a color scheme of golds and blues. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: ungoogled-chromium
description: Google Chromium, sans integration with Google
readme_summary: The ungoogled-chromium project aims to provide a version of Google Chromium without dependencies on Google web services. It focuses on enhancing privacy, control, and transparency by removing Google-specific code and binaries, while retaining the default Chromium experience as closely as possible.
key_features: Disabling functionality specific to Google domains (e.g., Google Host Detector, Google URL Tracker, Google Cloud Messaging)
Blocking internal requests to Google at runtime using domain substitution
Stripping binaries from the source code and replacing them with user-provided alternatives
primary_use_case: Providing a Chromium-based browser experience without reliance on Google's web services, enhancing user privacy and control.
cover_image_prompt: A meticulous surgeon carefully dissecting a complex mechanical heart labeled "Chromium," removing small, invasive components resembling Google logos. The surgeon uses precision tools and wears a sterile suit, working under bright surgical lights. Removed components are placed in a container labeled "Google Services." A clean, minimalist operating room with subtle UI elements displaying browser settings and privacy controls. The repository name, "ungoogled-chromium", is subtly displayed on a monitor. The scene has a clean, sterile atmosphere with a blue and white color scheme. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with sharp details.

name: flow-like
description: Flow-Like: Strongly Typed Enterprise Scale Workflows. Built for scalability, speed, seamless AI integration and rich customization.
readme_summary: Flow-Like is a visual workflow automation platform built with Rust, designed for enterprise-scale projects. It allows users to create automated workflows using a drag-and-drop interface, providing a clear record of data flow and changes. It supports AI integration, customizability, and deployment across various environments.
primary_use_case: Visual workflow automation for business processes, data integration, and AI-powered workflows.
cover_image_prompt: A master architect overseeing a bustling city where data flows like water through interconnected pipes and aqueducts. The architect uses a holographic interface to visually orchestrate the flow, ensuring each data stream reaches its destination efficiently. Glowing nodes represent different processes, and small screens display real-time data transformations. The city is powered by a central AI core that optimizes the workflow. The scene is set in a futuristic control room with bright, optimistic lighting. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with clean lines and vibrant colors.

name: vimmaster
description: VIM Master: in-browser game that teaches core Vim motions and editing commands through short, focused levels.
readme_summary: VIM Master is an in-browser game designed to teach users core Vim motions and editing commands through a series of short, focused levels. It provides a hands-on learning experience with features like normal/insert modes, command logging, progress tracking, and even a cheat mode for quick reference.
key_features: Complete Vim Support for core commands
primary_use_case: Learning and practicing Vim commands in an interactive game environment.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a grandmaster chess player, but instead of chess pieces, they are moving Vim commands across a glowing code screen. The screen displays a series of text-based puzzles, and each command executed by the player visibly alters the code, solving the puzzle. A holographic Vim tutor hovers nearby, offering subtle guidance. The scene is set in a futuristic training dojo with soft, ambient lighting. Small UI elements display the player's progress and earned badges. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and crisp details.
